content.question: A spring has its left end fixed to a wall and its right end attached to a box, which can move back and forth on a horizontal surface with negligible friction, as shown in the figure. When the spring is at its relaxed length the box is at position <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math>. The spring is compressed a distance <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math> from its relaxed length and the box is then released from rest at position <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math>. The box moves from position <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math> to position <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math>, continues moving on to position <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math> a distance <math alttext="the fraction x over 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math> to the right of <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math>, and continues moving beyond position <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math> toward the right. As the box moves, a block can be dropped onto the box from a small height just above the box. When this happens, the block sticks to the box in a perfectly inelastic collision and the two objects move together horizontally after colliding. At which labeled position(s) can the block be dropped onto the box so that the block-box system's total momentum and total kinetic energy are each the same immediately before and immediately after the collision? Neglect the block's vertical component of motion, and treat the collision as occurring instantaneously.

choices.label: At position <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math> only
At position <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math> only
At position <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math> only

At positions <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math>, <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>R</mtext></math>, and <math alttext="S" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>S</mtext></math>

content.answer: At position <math alttext="Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Q</mtext></math> only
